response.message:
No, same password. I've gotten reports that some browsers copy and paste the above password in with extra spaces for some reason... so you might try typing it in manually.

EDIT: never mind, I just added a .Trim() to the beta password entered, to make everyone's life easier..
Thanks for opening the registration, I work in at a sysadmin heavy company (3 programmers) and they have been waiting to get their hands on something like this.
Thanks! As a University UNIX admin, this will be helpful as I venture into the world beyond FreeBSD, Linux, and IRIX.

Not having 200 rep on SO yet, I wasn't able to access Server Fault until today.

When I went to sign in with my Google-based OpenID, SF noted that I had an account at a "sister site" and asked to migrate my account - I said yes.

It seems this didn't happen though, as it still showed me as "unknown (google)".

Is there anything special I need to do to have my account actually migrated, or is this as good as it gets?

Looking forward to using SF!
@me: Nevermind - I took Jeff's advice and set up my own OpenID. Of course, now I don't know if my accounts are "synced" or not. Oh well. Now wishing I could delete my previous comment...
@Shog9: this is kind of a special case where the password is fixed and already known.  If anything, he _wants_ people to guess this.
@Joel: yeah... But I thought of that question as soon as i read ".Trim()", and just couldn't resist.
Where do we send bugs to?

Please add a builtin ID provider, instead of exclusively using OpenID.  I've spent about 30 minutes over the past few weeks trying to get OpenID to work reasonably on the new site with my profile.

It just doesn't work, and the interface for adding new OpenID accounts to an existing account is horrible.
Yay! Hopefully you'll get crackin' on a similar site for enthusiast system builders soon.
